GameCore & Settings¶

Overview¶

PyNARGE applications are generally created by supplying a GameCore constructor with a Settings instance, adding some entities to the GameCore, and then calling GameCore.Run(). For example:

# Set some options
settings = Settings()
settings.display_size = Vec2(800, 600)

# Create an app with the options
app = GameCore(settings)

# Add an entity
app.entityManager.AddEntity( SomeEntity() )

# Begin the main loop
app.Run()

API¶

Sphinx doesn’t like documenting my initial values for some reason – check pn_settings.py to find default values that Settings will use. In short, “PyNARGE Window” at 800x600, windowed.

class PyNARGE.Settings¶

Stores settings for passing to a GameCore

antialiasing = None¶

Enable 8x antialiasing

display_fps = None¶

Show an FPS counter top-left of screen

display_fullscreen = None¶

Should the application run fullscreen

display_size = None¶

Resolution of the display

enable_lmb_manipulation = None¶

Enables physics interaction with left mouse button

enable_rmb_destruction = None¶

Enables destruction of physics entities with right mouse button

label_entity_types = None¶

Label entities with underlying class type

limit_framerate = None¶

Limits framerate to 60FPS. Required when using physics subsystem because changing timestep is unstable

window_title = None¶

The title of the window

class PyNARGE.GameCore(settings)¶

Engine host - sets up game subsystems, runs the application, does cleanup.

Run()¶

Call to run the engine: initial entities should be added before this is called

engineShaders = None¶

For getting default shaders & passes

entityManager = None¶

Entity management subsystem for game entities

input = None¶

Input subsystem

physicsWorld = None¶

Physics subsystem

renderer = None¶

Rendering subsystem

resourceManager = None¶

Resource managing subsystem

settings = None¶

The games’s settings

time = None¶

Utilitiy class for delta time etc.

uiManager = None¶

Entity management subsystem for UI
